ratings.comment: Ben is an amazing who takes time to form genuine relationships with his students and really wants to help you understand the material. He is always willing to change up wording or try explaining something in a different way to help a student understand. If you are willing to put effort in he will find ways to challenge you. Excellent instructor.
Ben is a great professor. Very exciting and makes lectures extremely interesting. Easy class as well as every assignment is pretty straight-forward. Highly recommend taking philosophy 341 with him.
Ben is one of the best lecturers I've ever had. The lecturers are super interesting and I look forward to going. He does a great job of facilitating discussion and being open minded.

I've had great profs. Ben beats them all. Gives so much individual feedback and personally helps you improve each assignment. He stayed after class just to discuss topics I found interesting. Looked forward to every lecturehe fosters rigorous debate in the classroom that's challenging yet accessible. He expects a lot, and helps you live up to it.
Ben is a really great guy. He will no doubt be an amazing professor.

I had never taken a philosophy course before and Ben's class far exceeded my expectations. The content was average but Ben is an amazing professor. His is extremely interesting, clear, and knowledgable. I would highly recommend this class just for Ben's sake. Few assignments and exams are fairly easy if you attend class.

Ben is a fantastic professor. Very clear in his explanations and incredibly approachable. He really encourages students to share their views in lecture and almost always indulges them. Though I wouldn't deem it necessary, you'll do much better if you do most of the reading. If you have the opportunity to take a class with him, seize it.

Ben is a fantastic guy and great teacher. He will certainly meet his aspirations of becoming a great philosophy professor. He leads class discussions well about difficult moral issues. Great class, even better teacher
